meanings.definition: Capable of being stretched or pulled without breaking.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was very tensile and could stretch far.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's tensile strength allowed it to withstand the pulling.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was so tensile that it never tore, even in strong winds.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as tensile as a steel cable, never breaking under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was incredibly tensile, able to catch even the smallest insects.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the ability to withstand tension.
meanings.sent1: The bridge's tensile design ensured it could handle heavy traffic.
meanings.sent2: The rope's tensile properties made it ideal for rock climbing.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's tensile humor kept the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: His friendship was as tensile as a safety net, always there when needed.
meanings.sent5: The tree's tensile branches swayed gracefully in the wind, never breaking.

meanings.definition: A force that tends to stretch or elongate a material.
meanings.sent1: The weightlifting champion felt the tensile in his muscles as he lifted.
meanings.sent2: The engineer calculated the tensile on the bridge to ensure its safety.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child felt the tensile in the rubber band before it snapped.
meanings.sent4: The ocean's waves exerted a constant tensile on the pier, causing it to sway.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds created a powerful tensile on the flag, making it flutter wildly.
